title: CBI arrests Manish Sisodia in excise policy case
content:
The Central Bureau of Investigation on Sunday arrested Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case, PTI reported.He was taken into custody after he was questioned by the central agency for over seven hours.An unidentified official told the news agency that Sisodia was asked about his links with entrepreneur Dinesh Arora and other accused in the case.VIDEO| Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia arrested by CBI for alleged corruption in implementing excise policy for 2021-22. pic.twitter.com/Y919O4Lbyp‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) February 26, 2023

‚ÄúThe CBI investigators were not satisfied with the responses provided by Sisodia,‚Äù the official said. ‚ÄúIt was claimed that he was not cooperating in the investigation and avoiding clarifications sought by officials on crucial points, leading to his arrest.‚ÄùSisodia and 14 other persons were booked by the CBI in August on charges of irregularities in the now-scrapped liquor policy, which was part of the new excise regulations. But the investigation agency deferred the questioning by a week after the deputy chief minister, who also holds the Delhi government‚Äôs finance portfolio, sought a week‚Äôs time for making the city‚Äôs Budget.On August 30, the agency had raided premises linked to the Aam Aadmi Party leader and other accused persons.The Enforcement Directorate is investigating a money laundering aspect in the case and has alleged that the liquor policy had caused a loss of Rs 2,873 crore to the government exchequer.Meanwhile, in another case pertaining to alleged snooping on political opponents, the Centre has permitted the Central Bureau of Investigation to probe Sisodia under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
